title: Grade 12 Mathematics Mock Exam 1
subject: Mathematics
description: A 10-question Grade 12 Mathematics mock exam based on the Zambian syllabus. Includes detailed explanations to strengthen conceptual understanding.

questions.question: This is a **mock Grade 12 Mathematics exam**. You will be tested on topics such as algebra, trigonometry, calculus, probability, and coordinate geometry. Read each question carefully and show all work if working on paper. Multiple-choice and short-answer questions are included.
Differentiate \(f(x) = 3x^3 - 5x^2 + 2x - 7\)
questions.explanation: Differentiate each term using power rule: \( rac{d}{dx}[3x^3] = 9x^2\), \( rac{d}{dx}[-5x^2] = -10x\), \( rac{d}{dx}[2x] = 2\), \( rac{d}{dx}[-7] = 0\). Final answer: \(9x^2 - 10x + 2\).

questions.question: A triangle has sides 7 cm, 24 cm and 25 cm. Is it a right-angled triangle?
options: Only if angle between 7 cm and 24 cm is 90Â°
questions.explanation: Check using Pythagoras: \(7^2 + 24^2 = 49 + 576 = 625 = 25^2\). Since the square of the longest side equals the sum of the squares of the other two, it is a right-angled triangle.

If \(\cos(	heta) = 0.6\) and \(	heta\) is acute, find \(\sin(	heta)\).
questions.explanation: Use identity: \(\sin^2(	heta) + \cos^2(	heta) = 1\). So, \(\sin^2(	heta) = 1 - 0.36 = 0.64\), and \(\sin(	heta) = \sqrt{0.64} = 0.8\) since \(	heta\) is acute.

questions.question: What is the area under the curve \(y = 2x\) from \(x = 0\) to \(x = 4\)?
Factorize completely: \(x^2 - 5x + 6\)
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to -5: -2 and -3. So, \(x^2 - 5x + 6 = (x - 3)(x - 2)\).

questions.question: Simplify: \( rac{2x^2 - 8}{x^2 - 4}\)
questions.explanation: Factor numerator and denominator: \(2x^2 - 8 = 2(x^2 - 4) = 2(x - 2)(x + 2)\), and \(x^2 - 4 = (x - 2)(x + 2)\). So, the expression simplifies to \( rac{2(x - 2)(x + 2)}{(x - 2)(x + 2)} = 2\), but we cancel (x - 2)(x + 2), final simplified expression is \(2\).
